tripleplay.game
Class ScreenStack

java.lang.Object
  tripleplay.game.ScreenStack

public abstract class ScreenStack
extends Object

Manages a stack of screens. The stack supports useful manipulations: pushing a new screen onto the stack, replacing the screen at the top of the stack with a new screen, popping a screen from the stack.

Care is taken to preserve stack invariants even in the face of errors thrown by screens when being added, removed, shown or hidden. Users can override handleError(java.lang.RuntimeException) and either simply log the error, or rethrow it if they would prefer that a screen failure render their entire screen stack unusable.

Field Detail

NOOP

public static final ScreenStack.Transition NOOP
Simply puts the new screen in place and removes the old screen.

originX

public float originX
The x-coordinate at which screens are located. Defaults to 0.

originY

public float originY
The y-coordinate at which screens are located. Defaults to 0.

Method Detail

slide

public ScreenStack.SlideTransition slide()
Creates a slide transition.

push

public void push(Screen screen)
push(Screen,Transition) with the default transition.

push

public void push(Screen screen,
                 ScreenStack.Transition trans)
Pushes the supplied screen onto the stack, making it the visible screen. The currently visible screen will be hidden.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied screen is already in the stack.

push

public void push(Iterable<? extends Screen> screens)
push(Iterable,Transition) with the default transition.

push

public void push(Iterable<? extends Screen> screens,
                 ScreenStack.Transition trans)
Pushes the supplied set of screens onto the stack, in order. The last screen to be pushed will also be shown, using the supplied transition. Note that the transition will be from the screen that was on top prior to this call.

popTo

public void popTo(Screen newTopScreen)
popTo(Screen,Transition) with the default transition.

popTo

public void popTo(Screen newTopScreen,
                  ScreenStack.Transition trans)
Pops the top screen from the stack until the specified screen has become the topmost/visible screen. If newTopScreen is null or is not on the stack, this will remove all screens.

replace

public void replace(Screen screen)
replace(Screen,Transition) with the default transition.

replace

public void replace(Screen screen,
                    ScreenStack.Transition trans)
Pops the current screen from the top of the stack and pushes the supplied screen on as its replacement.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied screen is already in the stack.

remove

public boolean remove(Screen screen)
remove(Screen,Transition) with the default transition.

remove

public boolean remove(Screen screen,
                      ScreenStack.Transition trans)
Removes the specified screen from the stack. If it is the currently visible screen, it will first be hidden, and the next screen below in the stack will be made visible.

update

public void update(float delta)
Updates the currently visible screen. A screen stack client should call this method from Game.update(float).

paint

public void paint(float alpha)
Paints the currently visible screen. A screen stack client should call this method from Game.paint(float).
